result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel G. Drews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Sauk County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: must contact P&P by 4 p.m. on 7-28-22

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA surcharge/sample.  Comply with any counseling/treatment per agent.  AODA & treatment.  Absolute sobriety at all times.  No possession of controlled substances without valid Rx and must report Rx to agent within 24 hours.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it. Random UA's per agent.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel G. Drews

records.addlTxt:
1:31 PM Prosecuting attorney Natalia J Gess and Intern, Dan Moon, in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel G. Drews in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Daniel G. Drews.  State states joint recommendation.  Atty Masana agrees.  No jail credit.  Both counsel make argument.  DE waives right to allocution.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 2: Dismissed but read in 

Count 1:

3 years Probation, must contact P&P by 4 p.m. on 7-28-22

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

Provide DNA surcharge/sample
Comply with any counseling/treatment per agent
AODA & treatment
Absolute sobriety at all times.
No possession of controlled substances without valid Rx and must report Rx to agent within 24 hours.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it. 
Random UA's per agent
$518.00 Fine/Costs fees (PAID THRU SAUK CO. CLERK OF COURTS) , 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan with the Sauk Co. Clerk of Courts

Paperwork handed in court.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Atty Masana received and waives reading of Information.  Atty Masana stands Mute.  DE advised of charges and penalties. Court enters Not Guilty Plea, to be set for TSC.  Bond continues.

11:36 AM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel G. Drews in court.  Attorney Peter Michael Masana in court for Daniel G. Drews.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 3.
Waiver of Prelim on June 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Absolute sobriety at all times.  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.
Waiver of Prelim on June 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:09 PM Defendant Daniel G. Drews in court with attorney Peter Michael Masana.  Defendant Daniel G. Drews in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Atty Masana states matter isn't resolved and request prelim.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on March 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on March 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:49 PM Defendant Daniel G. Drews in court with attorney Kathryn E Hayes.  Defendant Daniel G. Drews in custody.  C. Remington McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel G. Drews appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  DE does qualify for PD appt.  Court finds probable cause.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $500.00 signature bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety at all times.  Not to possess any controlled substances w/o a valid prescription.  If a prescription is received the DE must maintain it in it's original bottle showing the DE's name, the name of the substance and the name of the doctor who prescribed it.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.  Return date scheduled for March 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
